Fellows of this description, though perhaps devoid of any evil intent in their coming, seldom depart without the commission of mis- chief: sor they either cajole the Indians out of their clotheS, and other property, or corrupt them by indecent j0kes and actions, or, as is frequently the case, steal and carry home young men, marriageable girls, and even married women, to serve as domestic slaves, and often for worse purposes. Within two years seventy boys and girls were carried into captivity from the town of St. Stanislaus.
